p: Natural products have been used as medicines for centuries, however, only in the last century have researchers begun to diligently characterize their biological and chemical properties. Mushrooms are natural reservoirs of potent pharmaceuticals and are now the new interface for drug discovery. Mushrooms belong to ascomycetes and basidiomycetes phyla of the kingdom Fungi, and have been defined as “ epigeous and hypogeous fruiting bodies of macroscopic fungi” [ 1]. According to the recent estimates, fungi constitute 2.2–3.8 million species worldwide [ 2]. These fungal estimates include all the different types of fungi including mushrooms, the fruiting bodies of fungi. Another study provides estimates on the total number of mushrooms to be 140,000–160,000 where only 10% have been explored [ 3, 4].
